N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 ยง 175.3 - Computation of resident weighted average daily attendance and total wealth pupil units

State Regulations

An increase in resident weighted average daily attendance
and in total wealth pupil units resulting from the closing in whole, or in
part, of a nonpublic school, campus school or a school previously operated by
the United States Military Reservation at West Point shall be determined in the
following manner. The attendance of such children for the first full attendance
period of the year in which they first attend the schools of the district shall
be recorded separately and a resident weighted average daily attendance, and
also total wealth pupil units, computed from such separate attendance records. The resident weighted average daily attendance and total wealth pupil units so
computed, if either exceeds 100, shall be added to the resident weighted
average daily attendance and total wealth pupil units, respectively, for the
school year immediately preceding the base year. Such additional resident
weighted average daily attendance and total wealth pupil units, if either is
more than 100, shall, in the second school year of attendance of such
additional pupils, be added to the resident weighted average daily attendance
and total wealth pupil units, respectively, of the school year immediately
preceding the base year. Notes
